program_name_suffix: NYU Grossman School of Medicine Program
special_features_text: All residents get a book fund and a conference fund for education-related expenses. The book fund replenishes every academic year. We also provide a global health elective fund.
program_director_organization: New York University Langone Med Ctr
contact_organization: New York Univ Grossman Sch of Med

program_name_suffix: Mass General Brigham/Massachusetts General Hospital Program
special_features_text: Our program has a long-standing commitment to outstanding clinical training and the development of physician leaders in Medicine. Our dedicated faculty prepare you to become the best physician you want to be. Our goal is to help you reach your long-term career goals through a diverse range of clinical rotations and ambulatory experiences, using a unique team-based learning model, individualized mentoring program and a novel Pathways rotation that highlights critical thinking in medicine.

program_name_suffix: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai/Morningside/West Program
special_features_text: Robust clinical exposure at two hospitals in Manhattan. Exceptional oncologic experience at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. Three community based outpatient clinical training. Integrated with the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai.

program_name_suffix: Mass General Brigham/Brigham and Women's Hospital Program
University of Pennsylvania Health System Program
special_features_text: We are delighted to welcome trainees from dozens of medical schools spanning the nation and globe to our program. Our program features broad-based clinical training at varied inpatient and outpatient venues. Residents typically pursue independent scholarship, and enjoy a variety of wellness-themed activities. On annual surveys, residents highlight the spirit of camaraderie and level of departmental support as highlights of the program.
program_director_organization: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvan
contact_organization: Hosp of the Univ of Pennsylvania

program_name_suffix: Mayo Clinic College of Medicine and Science (Rochester) Program
special_features_text: Mayo Clinic established one of the world's first formalized physician training programs in 1915; the internal medicine residency has a long track record of transforming great medical students into outstanding physicians, educators, and scientists: 100% ABIM board pass rate. Robust primary care experience with a diverse local community and underserved population. Greater than 4 peer-reviewed pubs/resident;(national avg 0.6) Excellent fellowship match (90% match into top 3 choices).

program_name_suffix: University of Washington Program
special_features_text: Global health certification program, Housestaff Quality & Safety Council, wellness service, Network of Under-represented Residents & Fellows, safe ride home, free confidential counseling, learning specialist. Trainees receive an allowance in the sum of $8500, intended to offset the cost of living in Seattle. The allowance is included in the total compensation schedule which is paid out in each pay check throughout the academic year.
program_director_organization: Univ of Washington Sch of Med
contact_organization: Univ of Washington Sch of Med

program_name_suffix: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center Program
program_director_organization: Univ of Texas Southwestern Med Ctr
contact_organization: Univ of Texas Southwestern Med Ctr

program_name_suffix: Yale-New Haven Medical Center Program
special_features_text: We offer distinctions in education, global health, investigation, QI, and anti-racism. We have a 4+2+2 block schedule with ambulatory immersion experiences and exposure to specialty clinics. Residents can participate in our International Health Elective, Research in Residency Program, and Writer's Workshop. Qualified individuals may apply to our physician scientist track with guaranteed acceptance into fellowship assuming they meet professional competencies by the end of PGY2 year.

program_name_suffix: Emory University School of Medicine Program
Baylor College of Medicine Program
special_features_text: QI/Patient safety curriculum and specialty certification, tropical medicine certification, peer and faculty mentoring groups, an annual retreat, robust simulation program, Academy of Residents as Teachers, and wellness program. Extensive research opportunities. Diversity, equity and inclusion curriculum.

program_name_suffix: Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center Program
special_features_text: At BIDMC we are deeply committed to medical education, and have designed a curriculum tailored to the diverse needs and career goals of each resident, helping them to thrive and become future internists, specialists, and academic leaders. In addition to our formal tracks, residents participate in a robust and innovative QI/PS curriculum, and with the help of outstanding mentors, a research course, and dedicated research time; the majority of the residents successfully complete research projects.

program_name_suffix: University of California (San Francisco) Program
special_features_text: UCSF is a top mission-driven, public institution with stellar clinical and academic opportunities. The program offers training in three distinct hospital populations and the following areas of distinction: Molecular Medicine, Health Advocacy, Health Professions Education, Health Systems Leadership, Global Health, leadership, PRIME, Informatics. The R2 and R3 years are a 4+4 model with an innovative longitudinal clinical curriculum to learn both primary care and subspecialty medicine.

program_name_suffix: University of Michigan Program
special_features_text: Our residents represent a talented, highly-motivated group of individuals. The department's strength in investigation and clinical care delivery coupled with outstanding full-time faculty make the University of Michigan a unique training environment. https://medicine.umich.edu/dept/intmed/education-training/residency-program

program_name_suffix: Washington University/B-JH/SLCH Consortium Program
special_features_text: We provide an extensive clinical experience in a 1400-bed, tertiary referral center along with opportunities to participate in research, education, quality improvement, global health, advocacy, and primary care through formal training tracks, mentorship, and the abundant resources of one of the nation's premiere academic institutions.  Learn from clinics and consult rotations in any of our top-ranked subspecialties and thrive in a program that prioritizes a culture of growth and camaraderie.

program_name_suffix: University of Maryland Program
special_features_text: The University of Maryland is a major urban academic center that serves a broad spectrum of patients from Baltimore City and surrounding communities. Our curriculum supports robust clinical training in a learning environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance. Approximately 70% pursue fellowships. In addition to an annual educational allowance, we subsidize 90% of parking, the ABIM Certification exam, national abstract presentations, manuscript publications, and international rotations.

program_name_suffix: MedStar Health Georgetown University (Baltimore) Program
special_features_text: We're so glad you've chosen to apply to our program! Please note this program is locally known and on our website as MedStar Health Internal Medicine, Baltimore. This program is the only internal medicine residency at MedStar Good Samaritan, MedStar Franklin Square, MedStar Harbor Hospital, and MedStar Union Memorial hospitals. Applying to this program encompasses all of those locations and includes both preliminary and categorical tracks.

program_name_suffix: UCLA David Geffen School of Medicine/UCLA Medical Center Program
University of Utah Health Program
special_features_text: From high-value care training, to Global Health electives in Rwanda and Colombia, to addiction medicine training, to the Utah StARR track, we continue innovating to meet the diverse needs of our residents and their future patients. Our program mission is: To provide exceptional, high quality, diverse clinical experiences, to allow for individualized education plans and experiences, to optimize education within workflow, and to engage residents in leadership and allow them to lead.

program_name_suffix: University of Colorado Program
special_features_text: Join the University of Colorado IM residency program as we cultivate the next generation of physician-leaders in patient care, biomedical discovery, educational innovation, and health systems design. We provide a multi-site clinical experience, curricular tracks and pathways to customize your training, dedicated and diverse faculty and layers of mentorship and coaching. Our graduates are successful, confident, lifelong learners. Find more at https://medschool.cuanschutz.edu/medicine/residency
program_director_organization: University of Colorado School of Medicin
contact_organization: Univ of Colorado Sch of Med

program_name_suffix: Zucker School of Medicine at Hofstra/Northwell at Staten Island University Hospital Program
special_features_text: 1) 4+1 structure. 2) subspecialty clinic assigned. 3) Protected time for teaching, 1/2 day academic days. 4) Med ED Track. 5) Research Track. 6) Performance Improvement projects. 7) POCUS rotation. 8) Community outreach services. 9) Research mentoring. 10) Resident wellness days. 11) Global Health

program_name_suffix: Duke University Hospital Program
special_features_text: Our mission is to create an engaging, diverse, adaptive learning environment to train leaders in clinical care, research, advocacy, education, and innovation. We achieve our goals by focusing on 3 pillars of development: - 1) Clinical - growth through graduated autonomy  - 2) Professional - finding your "and" through unique tracks and robust mentorship - 3) Personal - supported individual growth - We value resident feedback and view our residents and their significant others as part of our Duke

program_name_suffix: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai/Beth Israel Program
special_features_text: We offer the following unique educational programming in addition to our regular electives and rotations: Medical Education Track (2y), Leadership Development Program (1y), Patient Safety/Quality Improvement elective, Hospitalist elective, and a Critical Care/POCUS elective.
program_director_organization: Mount Sinai Beth Israel (PROGRAM IS CLOS
contact_organization: Mount Sinai Beth Israel (PROGRAM IS CLOS

program_name_suffix: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai/Mount Sinai Hospital Program
special_features_text: Research Track for physician-scientists. Community Primary Care Track, Medical Education Track, Health Care Leadership Track, and Medical Genomics Track, Global Health Track, R38 Research Pathway available.
program_director_organization: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

program_name_suffix: Cleveland Clinic Foundation Program
special_features_text: The Cleveland Clinic Internal Medicine Residency Program cultivates internists who achieve distinction in clinical care, scholarship, leadership, collaboration, and commitment to lifelong learning within a supportive, innovative learning environment that fosters diversity and inclusion.

program_name_suffix: One Brooklyn Health System/Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center Program
program_director_organization: Brookdale Univ Hosp and Med Ctr
contact_organization: Brookdale Univ Hosp and Med Ctr

program_name_suffix: SUNY Downstate Health Sciences University Program
special_features_text: Our mission is to train the next generation of scholarly compassionate physicians that care for and improve the health and the lives of our diverse communities, providing the highest quality patient-centered care that is both evidence-based and culturally tailored. Our vision is to become a magnet program that attracts high quality candidates to complete their training in Internal Medicine and its sub-specialties. - Please note that the information listed is subject to change without notice.

program_name_suffix: SUNY Upstate Medical University Program
special_features_text: Upstate's innovative internal medicine program allows residents to prepare for careers in primary health care, subspecialty training, academic medicine, and community health. Whatever your goals are, we will help you achieve them. We invite you to learn more about our training, our facilities, our city, and more importantly, the lives of the people who make this program an outstanding place for resident training.

program_name_suffix: University of Southern California/Los Angeles General Medical Center (USC/LA General) Program
special_features_text: USC internal medicine residents are exposed to a scope of clinical pathology that is unrivaled in the US. The breadth of our curriculum provides a unique range of experiences in ambulatory and inpatient care. Residents work alongside faculty on research projects, infusing scientific investigation into their comprehensive medical education. USC's remarkable clinical opportunities, structured teaching and clinical programs foster the maturation of our residents into excellent clinicians.

program_name_suffix: University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston Program
special_features_text: Our program is designed to ensure the success of our incredible, diverse residents. We have certificate programs in research, leadership, teaching, and management. To ensure residents can take advantage of these opportunities, we designed our schedule to prevent burnout, with no 24h call and administrative time starting intern year. Our outstanding clinical opportunities range from MD Anderson Cancer Center to a large county hospital serving the indigent population of Houston.

program_name_suffix: Zucker School of Medicine at Hofstra/Northwell Program
special_features_text: An international global elective rotation in Uganda, is one of the new elective rotations added to the program. We also offer Research, IMPACcT primary care Interprofessional, Enhance Comm Health, Clin. Educator, Health Reform & Advocacy, Lifestyle medicine residency curriculum, and POCUS tracks.

program_name_suffix: Montefiore Medical Center/Albert Einstein College of Medicine (Moses and Weiler Campuses) Program
special_features_text: Our program has a firm system of three groups composed of PGY1-PGY3s with dedicated faculty leaders. Residents rotate on wards, CCU, MICU with rotations in medical consult, geriatrics, neurology, oncology, hepatology and the ER. Clinic is a 6+2 rotation where residents are the primary provider for their patients. Residents participate in cutting-edge biomedical and clinical research. We have specialized tracks in hospital medicine, medical education, intensified research and global health.

program_name_suffix: Ohio State University Hospital Program
special_features_text: We stress the importance of clinical excellence and dedication to scholarship. All interns participate in a Leadership Development Program. All residents receive protected time for research (up to 3 months total). Ambulatory training benefits from our 8 + 4 schedule (4 + 4 for Primary Care Track). Inpatient experience includes specialty services in cancer, heart, transplant med and liver. We offer pathways to research, hospital med, teaching/leadership & Global Scholars.
program_director_organization: Ohio State Univ Wexner Med Ctr

program_name_suffix: UMass Chan Medical School Program
special_features_text: Highly competitive program in University-based Medical Center & the largest safety net hospital in MA. Residents manage diversity of conditions including liver, renal, bone marrow transplant, advance heart failure & MICU patients.Intern cap of 8, EPIC EMR & no 24hour shifts.Auxillary staff support for work to education balance.Teaching & mentoring are top priority.Offer tracks in Research & Med Ed. Over 97% fellowship match rate in top programs.Program expansion to a 3+2 schedule in 2024.

program_name_suffix: Vanderbilt University Medical Center Program
special_features_text: Vanderbilt is the only major academic tertiary center in our region which has a catchment area of nearly 5 million people. Our mission is to train future leaders in academic medicine who will improve the human condition through the practice of medicine, education, research, and service. Our residents manage patients with complex medical conditions in an environment that emphasizes resident autonomy, resident wellness, bedside teaching, science, and a physiology-based approach to medicine.

program_name_suffix: Virginia Commonwealth University Health System Program
special_features_text: Collegial housestaff, diverse patient population, resident teaching retreat based on Stanford clinical teaching program, intro to clinical research seminar series,  physiology course, board review question bank, and web-based curriculum. Career development.

program_name_suffix: Rhode Island Hospital/Brown University Health Program
special_features_text: The PGY2 and PGY3 residents interested in health problems in developing nations may participate in our international health track or electives. Opportunities: Brown-Kenya medical exchange program, international health partnership with Santiago Hospital in the Dominican Republic.

program_name_suffix: Temple University Hospital Program
special_features_text: We care for a medically complex,urban,underserved patient population.Quaternary care center, advanced CHF services,pulmonary HTN center,leading lung transplant center.Oncology experience at affiliated Fox Chase Cancer Center.6+2 scheduling with dedicated ambulatory block and built-in wellness half day.Med Ed,Primary Care,Health Systems(QI/Leadership),and unique Urban Bioethics track.Novel community engagement curriculum.We value diversity because it leads to better patient care and education.

program_name_suffix: University of California (Irvine) Program
special_features_text: We provide rotations in the PGY1 and PGY2 year dedicated to teaching skills and the business of medicine. We provide didactics on the use of bedside ultrasound and state of the art simulation.

program_name_suffix: UPMC Medical Education Program
special_features_text: We are dedicated to developing physician leaders through an innovative curriculum, individualized educational experiences and dedicated mentorship programs in order to facilitate the career goals of each resident. We are dedicated to developing physician leaders of diverse experiences and talents to become agents of change and transform the science of medicine and to provide compassionate, evidence-based care to their patients.

program_name_suffix: University of Miami/Jackson Health System Program
special_features_text: JMH, the major teaching institution for University of Miami serves the diverse patient population of Miami-Dade County. Our program offers block scheduling and several career development pathways including global health, fellowship, medical education urban health, and healthcare administration. We have a dedicated resident wellness elective that includes mindfulness, nutrition, and exercise as part of our routine curriculum. Wellness is a priority and we have no 24 hour call.

program_name_suffix: Boston University Medical Center Program
special_features_text: Please visit our website:https://www.bumc.bu.edu/im-residency/ Pathway offerings include multiple research options, urban health, global health, HIV, QI and a medical educator track. Resident run committees provide ample opportunity for trainee involvement in program leadership. Committees include: Women in Medicine, Diversity and Inclusion, Research, Wellness and Operations. Please see website for additional highlights.

program_name_suffix: University of South Florida Morsani Program
special_features_text: Program provides weekly board review; four-day board review for PGY3s; 2 year subscription to USMLE World Q-bank for boards in third year; five-day annual conference leave for presenters; GME scholarly support to attend meetings; X+Y schedules; MKSAP purchased by program.
program_director_organization: USF Health Morsani Coll of Med
contact_organization: USF Health Morsani Coll of Med

program_name_suffix: Jefferson Health Medical Education/Jefferson Einstein Philadelphia Hospital Program
special_features_text: Our program provides formal point of care ultrasound training. We also offer a center for medical simulation where residents have the opportunity to learn and practice procedures. Our Resident Run Wellness Committee offers a variety of activities for residents. The committee meets to develop ideas and plan activities.

program_name_suffix: Loma Linda University Health Education Consortium Program
special_features_text: High-fidelity simulation lab, EBM curriculum, focus on whole-person care. We are aligned to a common goal of treating patients with respect and dignity; we can provide a work environment where compassion and professionalism are role-modeled.

program_name_suffix: McGaw Medical Center of Northwestern University Program
program_director_organization: McGaw Medical Center of Northwestern Uni

program_name_suffix: Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center Program
special_features_text: Lincoln is located in the heart of NYC serving a community of almost 300,000. Residents have the opportunity to diagnose and treat wide variety of diseases and complications, perform different procedures and receive high class education during in-patient rotations, ICU, emergency department, outpatient department and subspecialty services. All residents are required to have scholarly activities. There is an emphasis on POCUS training. We have high fellowship match rate and ABIM pass rate.

program_name_suffix: University of Connecticut Program
special_features_text: Clinician-educator track, office-based medicine track, Osteopathic distinction, international experiences, simulation centers, ultrasound curriculum, resident wellness program, and on-site board review course available. Educational and travel stipend provided.

program_name_suffix: Johns Hopkins University Program
special_features_text: We have numerous educational innovations, pathways, and unique structures. Please visit our website for more information  - https://www.hopkinsmedicine.org/medicine/education/osler-medical-residency

program_name_suffix: Rutgers Health/New Jersey Medical School Program
special_features_text: Exceptional training program! Great clinical teaching. Diverse residents and faculty. Amazing pathology. Supportive and innovative program leadership. Cutting-edge tracks (i.e. Urban Health, Clinician Educator, 4-year IM/preventive medicine, HIV Primary Care). Interdisciplinary POCUS curriculum. Happiest and friendliest residents you will ever meet! A great place to work and learn!

program_name_suffix: University of Florida Program
special_features_text: The UF medicine residency program provides a supportive environment to learn the art and science of high-quality, patient-centered, compassionate medical care. Residents experience an incredible depth of educational value of clinical experiences. Our training program is committed to fostering collegiality and team work and to cultivating physician leaders. Gainesville, FL offers a safe, affordable university community with an extensive collection of recreational and cultural events.
program_director_organization: Univ of Florida Coll of Med
contact_organization: Univ of Florida Coll of Med

program_name_suffix: University of Illinois College of Medicine at Chicago Program
special_features_text: We primarily care for the underserved in Chicago. Training at the University of Illinois Hospital and Jesse Brown VA, only three blocks apart. Free enrollment in school of public health. Specialized tracks: urban global health, acad. IM, leaders for local change, med-ed,, innovation track. Street medicine program provides care for undomiciled at their living location. Inpatient specialty services: Sickle cell, hematology, oncology, hepatology, and cardiology. International rotations available.

program_name_suffix: Cook County Health and Hospitals System Program
special_features_text: Our residents train in a safety net hospital, providing world-class care for all, regardless of socioeconomic status, and a commitment to train the next generation of primary care physicians. - We follow an X+Y+Z block schedule and have several in-house fellowship programs. Our residents match to competitive fellowships due to our exceptional clinical training, high board pass rates, and international reputation. Follow us on Instagram @cookcountyimr.

program_name_suffix: New York Presbyterian Hospital (Columbia Campus) Program
New York Presbyterian Hospital (Cornell Campus) Program
program_director_address_line1: Dept of Med Box 130 Rm M507
contact_address_line1: Dept of Med Box 130 Rm M-514

program_name_suffix: University of New Mexico School of Medicine Program
special_features_text: UNM is the only internal medicine training site in the State of New Mexico. As the tertiary and quaternary care center, clinical case diversity is excellent. Dedicated block didactics and a 3+1 augment resident learning and wellness.

program_name_suffix: University of Texas Health Science Center San Antonio Joe and Teresa Lozano Long School of Medicine Program
special_features_text: UT Health San Antonio offers excellent clinical training and opportunities for residents to explore individual interests. The program is on a 4+1 system, and residents rotate at a university and a VA hospital. Electives include global health, POCUS, subspecialty clinical and research electives. Special tracks include an ultrasound certification track, a clinician educator track, a health equity track, an HIV Track and a PGY3 ambulatory track.
program_director_organization: Univ of Texas HSC San Antonio
contact_organization: Univ of Texas HSC San Antonio

program_name_suffix: Case Western Reserve University/University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center Program
special_features_text: We are committed to maintaining a program of the highest academic standards with scholarly approach to the practice of medicine. And while we promote an environment of academic rigor, our faculty fosters a supportive and collegial relationship with the medical interns and residents. Our program is based on two themes: patient care and career development.

program_name_suffix: George Washington University Program
special_features_text: Our mission is to create a diverse physician workforce dedicated to social justice, intellectual curiosity and process-improvement. We strive to develop each resident's ability to deliver evidence-based, humanistic, high-quality medical care, and to prepare our graduates to be leaders and scholars in their fields. Our curriculum is intentionally designed to develop trainees who are skilled in patient-centered, evidence-based medicine; patient safety and high value care; and healthy equity.

program_name_suffix: MedStar Health/Georgetown-Washington Hospital Center Program
special_features_text: Nationally recognized academic medical center. Largest and most comprehensive hospital in the DC region. Fellowships programs in virtually all specialties. Outstanding fellowship and job placement record.

program_name_suffix: New York-Presbyterian Brooklyn Methodist Hospital Program
special_features_text: The NewYork-Presbyterian Brooklyn Methodist Hospital Internal Medicine Residency Program is in Brooklyn, New York and serves a patient population with incredibly rich racial, ethnic, and socioeconomic diversity. Our hospital is a 591-bed teaching hospital affiliated with the New York-Presbyterian Healthcare System and Weill Cornell Medicine and has a high patient turnover and level of acuity. We are a level 2 trauma center, STEMI and ECMO center, and certified stroke and thrombectomy center.

program_name_suffix: Tulane University Program
special_features_text: The Tulane Internal Medicine Residency Program is a place for those who want to make a difference - right here and right now. Responsibility is a fixture of our program because the people in our wonderful, vibrant, and resilient city of New Orleans need it. Our program is built by its residents. From making schedules to shaping our match list, much of our program is organized by our residents. We would love for you to apply.

program_name_suffix: University of Arizona College of Medicine-Tucson Program
special_features_text: Our program, located in Tucson, Arizona, is at the base of the gorgeous Catalina Mountains. Within the area are excellent hiking, biking, skiing, and rich cultural heritages. Within driving distance, you are able to visit Mexico, Las Vegas, California and the Grand Canyon. Tucson gets 350 days of sunshine annually--more than any other US city! We promote fellowships and research and our graduates enter a variety of careers from academic medicine, to in and out-patient, to specialty fellowships.
program_director_organization: Univ of Arizona Coll of Med-Tucson
contact_organization: Univ of Arizona Coll of Med-Tucson

program_name_suffix: University of California (San Diego) Medical Center Program
University of Wisconsin Hospitals and Clinics Program
special_features_text: Our program prioritizes personalized scheduling for career goals. Extensive mentoring and coaching program. Comprehensive curriculum including communication, empathy, self-care, QI, and simulation. Dedicated faculty. $500 annual well-being stipend for personal wellness. Six weeks paid leave for all parents, high Board pass rate, top tier research campus, excellent fellowship and job matches. Madison voted friendliest Midwest city. Program promotes enjoyable work environment and camaraderie.
program_director_organization: Univ of Wisconsin Hosp and Clinics
contact_organization: Univ of Wisconsin Hosp and Clinics

program_name_suffix: Zucker School of Medicine at Hofstra/Northwell at Lenox Hill Hospital Program
special_features_text: Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan features patient diversity, outstanding teaching, three US allopathic medical school affiliations, ambulatory block rotations, primary care, and HIV specialist tracks and many community service opportunities. Inpatient service is regionalized (geographic), interdisciplinary and involves no overnight call. Outpatient experience is on a 6+2 block system with a half-day of academics built in.

program_name_suffix: Allegheny Health Network Medical Education Consortium (AGH) Program
special_features_text: Welcome to our Program! We offer robust yet decompressed opportunities for your growth as a physician. We're advanced in POCUS, and offer tracks in Primary Care, Geriatrics, Gender-Based Medicine, Medical Education, Lifestyle Medicine, Medical Research, and Inclusion Health. We have innovative curricula e.g. resident rooftop garden and strong preparation for both fellowship and general medicine. At Allegheny, we take medicine seriously, but don't take ourselves too seriously!

program_name_suffix: New York Medical College/St Mary and St Clare Program
special_features_text: Our program utilizes paid time off (PTO) for sick & vacation time. Residents receive a total of 20 PTO days. Life-work balance is important. While providing excellent education, the program offers the extra benefit of bringing residents closer to their family and friends in the tri-state area. Passaic, Denville, and the surrounding towns all boast excellent dining, historical sites, and activities to explore.

program_name_suffix: Nassau University Medical Center Program
University of Chicago Program
special_features_text: We also offer a physician scientist development program that facilitates the pursuit of ABIM's research pathway for those interested primarily in research. Individuals in this pathway receive additional educational funding and mentorship.

program_name_suffix: University of Cincinnati Medical Center/College of Medicine Program
special_features_text: The University of Cincinnati is interactive, open minded, patient-centered, and outcomes oriented. We are looking for residents who are more 'we' than 'me', and who have a passion for improving the lives of others. We believe in Growth Mindset and organize our learning experiences around these principles. We celebrate diversity of lived experiences.

program_name_suffix: University of Louisville School of Medicine Program
special_features_text: Intensive one-on-one resident mentoring by program directors. X + Y scheduling. Extensive, structured didactic program using live and online lectures (LouisvilleLectures.org) and guided independent study. Three different training sites with a diverse population of patients and pathologies.

program_name_suffix: BayCare Health System Program
special_features_text: The St. Joseph's Hospital Internal Medicine Residency Program is a community-care focused training program that will provide much needed services to the families in multiple locations throughout West Central Florida. We offer a comprehensive salary and benefit package to our trainees and our goal is to retain the residents we train to say and serve in our Tampa Bay Community!
program_director_organization: 3003 W Dr Martin Luther King Jr Blvd
program_director_address_line2: 3003 W Dr Martin Luther King Jr Blvd
contact_address_line2: 3003 W Dr Martin Luther King Jr Blvd

program_name_suffix: Detroit Medical Center/Wayne State University Program
Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai/NYC Health and Hospitals (Elmhurst) Program
special_features_text: Our hospital is in one of the most diverse communities in the world. We turn no one away and provide state-of-the-art care for those who often have nowhere else to go. Our faculty are seasoned clinicians committed to teaching and to our mission. The atmosphere in the program is that of enthusiasm and collegiality. Our residents also rotate at Mount Sinai Hospital, a world-renowned university hospital. We will help you develop into the best physician you can be. Check out elmhurstmedicine.com!

program_name_suffix: University of Alabama Medical Center Program
special_features_text: UAB provides comprehensive clinical training with an emphasis on clinical reasoning in a supportive and caring learning environment. Our main medical center is a quaternary referral center for the Southeast, so we care for patients with a broad array of pathology. We have structured our program intentionally to provide diverse clinical experiences and progressive autonomy so our residents are well-prepared to manage any clinical situation upon graduation.

program_name_suffix: University of North Carolina Hospitals Program
special_features_text: The UNC program is built upon collegiality and a shared mission to care for the people of our state. We seek residents who are passionate about providing clinical care in a supportive environment that also encourages resident autonomy. UNC combines an outstanding research engine with a state institution that provides care to all regardless of their ability to pay with strengths in global health, health care disparities research, and care for the underserved.

program_name_suffix: University of Texas Medical Branch Hospitals Program
program_director_organization: Univ of Texas Med Branch Hosps
contact_organization: Univ of Texas Med Branch Hosps

program_name_suffix: Cedars-Sinai Medical Center Program
special_features_text: Follow us on X and Instagram @csimresidents
program_director_address_line1: Dept of Internal Medicine Ste B113
contact_address_line1: Dept of Internal Medicine Ste B113

program_name_suffix: Louisiana State University (Shreveport) Program
special_features_text: We offer a diverse patient population, resident autonomy with adequate supervision by enthusiastic and experienced faculty. As an intern/resident, you fully interact daily with our 10 internal medicine subspecialty fellowship programs. We also offer a Clinician Educator track, Hospitalist track and POCUS curriculum.

program_name_suffix: Medical College of Wisconsin Affiliated Hospitals Program
special_features_text: Academic medical center program with VA and community hospitals also. Wide range of patients, primary to quaternary care. Graduates go into wide range of careers. Large city with diverse options for housing, lifestyle, recreation.

program_name_suffix: NYU Grossman Long Island School of Medicine Program
special_features_text: NYU Langone Hospital--Long Island is a world class 591 bed hospital in a suburban setting. You will benefit from the guidance of full-time faculty dedicated to patient care, research and medical education. Upon completion of the program, our residents are well prepared to enter private internal medicine practice or pursue highly competitive training at top fellowships throughout the United States. We offer 12 ACGME accredited Fellowships.
program_director_organization: NYU Grossman Long Island Sch of Med
contact_organization: NYU Grossman Long Island Sch of Med

program_name_suffix: University of Chicago (Endeavor Health NorthShore Hospitals) Program
special_features_text: The University of Chicago (Endeavor Health, formally NorthShore University) internal medicine residency Evanston Hospital site is home to a 13,000 square foot simulation center which enables a robust simulation curriculum. There is also an international rotation available in Haiti for selected residents.

program_name_suffix: Baylor Scott & White Medical Center - Baylor College of Medicine (Temple) Program
Henry Ford Health/Henry Ford Hospital Program
Sidney Kimmel Medical College at Thomas Jefferson University/TJUH Program
special_features_text: We offer training in teaching skills through a nationally recognized course entitled Teaching Residents to Teach. Clinical teaching electives are available for residents who wish to pursue academic careers.  We offer Personalized Career Pathways to allow residents to customize their training experience throughout their residency.

program_name_suffix: University of Kansas School of Medicine Program
special_features_text: Our program utilizes a 3+1 schedule; this scheduling allows us to be innovative in our delivery of educational content. We ensure an abundance of research time and support to ready our residents for their next professional step. We offer several educational pathways to provide individualization of our residents' educational experience. Our program emphasizes development of leadership and emotional intelligence acumen to empower our resident physicians to be leaders in their fields.

program_name_suffix: Wake Forest University Baptist Medical Center Program
special_features_text: Our program prepares residents to deliver top-notch care while embedding lifelong learning skills to succeed in any career pathway. Wake Forest residents experience the full spectrum of internal medicine in a variety of settings and can take advantage of specialized pathways to pursue their professional interests in - primary care, hospital medicine, point of care ultrasound, medical education, research, informatics and global health.

program_name_suffix: Howard University Program
Maimonides Medical Center Program
Olive View/UCLA Medical Center Program
special_features_text: International health electives. Full electronic sign-out and panel management system. Patient-centered medical home in ambulatory care. MKSAP and UWorld provided. Educational stipend given to all residents. Teaching inpatient/outpatient procedure services. ACP membership provided (senior residents). Tracks offered: Medical Education and Healthcare Leadership & Advocacy. Full Ultrasound curriculum. Implicit bias training for faculty and residents. Anti-racism in medicine curriculum. UCLA Benefits

program_name_suffix: Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU Health) Program
special_features_text: We offer the option of tracking in or out of primary care or global health. We have a specific curriculum for each track. All residents participate in a variety of community settings, including our affiliated VA Medical Center, Kaiser Permanente (HMO), Providence Hospital, and Central City Concern (social medicine). We have a dedicated advocacy curriculum that is taught during the clinic weeks (every fourth week).

program_name_suffix: University of Virginia Medical Center Program
special_features_text: UVA Internal Medicine residents see the widest array of patient pathology under one hospital roof. As colleagues and friends, residents experience a foundation of resident-centered education and a culture balancing autonomy with support. We use a tailored and personalized approach to career development on top of this clinical foundation with layers of mentorship and opportunities for diverse supplemental training tracks. We are committed to improving diversity and equity at UVA Health.

program_name_suffix: Wright Center for Graduate Medical Education Program A
special_features_text: Join The Wright Center for Graduate Medical Education in Scranton, one of the largest internal medicine programs with 111 residents. Receive comprehensive training from expert faculty who offer personalized mentorship for diverse patient care scenarios. Whether you aim for general practice, subspecialties, or academia, our tailored pathways support your career goals. Enjoy the benefits of a vibrant city close to major hubs like New York and Philadelphia. Contact us now to learn more.
program_director_organization: The Wright Center for Graduate Medical E
contact_organization: The Wright Center for Graduate Med Educa

program_name_suffix: Indiana University School of Medicine Program
special_features_text: Four hospital collaborative system with diverse patient populations and flexibility to customize training. Multiple optional pathways for additional training opportunities.  Safety & QI training for all residents. Opt-out mental health counseling and generous parental policies. Goal to graduate leaders in health care.

program_name_suffix: Mobile Infirmary Medical Center Program
University of Tennessee Program
special_features_text: UTHSC provides a vigorous clinical learning environment with a diversity of patients, pathology and training sites. We have a new state of the art simulation center with a well developed simulation curriculum. We promote opportunities in culinary medicine, research, QI, and wellness programs. Our residents enjoy camaraderie with their colleagues and faculty during events outside the workplace. We are proud of our graduate's success in achieving their career goals.
program_director_organization: Univ of Tennessee Health Science Ctr

program_name_suffix: BronxCare Health System Program
special_features_text: A well-organized program with full time on-site faculty. A thoroughly revised curriculum to meet the needs of today's internist. Experience working with a diverse population in a supportive and learning environment.

program_name_suffix: Jacobi Medical Center/Albert Einstein College of Medicine Program
special_features_text: In addition to salary: All Residents receive a meal stipend of $3,500 annually; $200 for each holiday worked and 2 personal days off annually on top of vacation blocks.

program_name_suffix: Loyola University Medical Center Program
special_features_text: Loyola offers a robust clinical training experience in an established 4+1 scheduling system. In addition, our residents benefit from protected educational Friday School curriculum, extensive simulation training, ultrasound, research, and QI curricula with broad resident participation in research, ABIM preparation assistance, annual retreats and wellness events, an established advising program, an active Diversity Council, and excellent post-residency fellowship/practice placement.
